intro: Bernardia brasiliensis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved bernardia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
